name: Rambla de Montevideo
description: The iconic waterfront for walking, running, and enjoying the sunset over the Río de la Plata.

name: Ciudad Vieja & Puerta de la Ciudadela
description: Historic center with colonial architecture, cafés, markets, and the emblematic Puerta de la Ciudadela.

name: Teatro Solís
description: Uruguay’s main theater (1856). Guided tours and cultural programming throughout the year.

name: Parque Rodó
address: Av. Julio Herrera y Reissig s/n, Montevideo
description: Tree-lined park with a lake, attractions, and picnic areas near the university district.

name: Mercado Agrícola de Montevideo (MAM)
description: Gastronomic and cultural market in a restored historic building, ideal for lunch or shopping.

name: Antel Arena
description: Multipurpose arena for concerts and large-scale sports or technology events.

name: Parque Roosevelt
description: Metropolitan green lung, perfect for outdoor activities and sports.

name: Montevideo Tech Hub
description: Innovation hub, startups, and networking space for the tech community.
